page.title: 11HOME LIFE
page.content: Households with their own transport prefer to buy their food and other requirements more cheaply from supermarkets in Diss or Lowestoft, the village shop tends to be used by those without transport or those wishing to buy locally. The preserving of fruit & vegetables has largrly been superceded by the deep freeze. Cooking is mainly on electric stoves although some prefer bottled gas or oil, solid fuel or wood burning stoves. A few own micro wave ovens. Meal times are variable & are mostly prepared by the women.Houses are heated by electricity, oil or solid fuel. There are also some wood or straw burning heaters & many still enjoy an open fire. Although there is no mains drainage nearly all houses have indoor toilets & their own septic tank.Most households own a washing machine.
